text.p: Let [mathjaxinline]\mathcal{B} = \{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline] be as pictured; this is a basis of [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline].
Given the vector [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] in the image, what is [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}}[/mathjaxinline]?

div.h4: How to Enter a Column Vector in R^n

div.p: To enter a vector in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^ n[/mathjaxinline] such as [mathjaxinline]\left[\begin{array}{c} 1 \\ 2 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline], you can either:

li.p: enter it as you would a [mathjaxinline]3\times 1[/mathjaxinline] matrix: [[1],[2],[3]]
or, you can enter it as <1,2,3>

font.p: We can write [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] as a linear combination of the basis vectors in order: [mathjaxinline]w = 5v_1 + 3v_2[/mathjaxinline]. Hence [mathjaxinline][w]_{\mathcal{B}} =\left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 3 \end{array} \right][/mathjaxinline].
